p: To obtain the values of the electrochemical parameters the parameterisation of Equation (1) is considered, and broken down in Equation (2); furthermore, each parameter is expressed in Ec. 3–5. Ec. 6 shows the dependence of the current on the scanning rate in terms of the average superficial reaction of the electrode ip. The extension of Figure 7 shows the linear dependence on the value of the anodic peak (I OX) and the cathode (I RED) potential value to the scan rate logarithm. The function describes that the behavior of the anodic peak potential is Ep = 0.663–0.033 V (5.411 + log v), with a linear correlation of 0.9643 of the data. Meanwhile, for the potential of the cathode peak at Ep = 0.830–0.0498 V (6.54 × 10 −6 + log v), there is a linear correlation of 0.9999, which may indicate that there are diffusion mechanisms in the electrode.
